title: 820-3476 Camera not detected
message:
Hello,

We have that board which won't detect a camera.
We have tried a known good display and same result.

I did test in diode mode the camera connector with the camera plugged and not plugged and compared it with a known working board.
Here are the results: [TABLE="border: 0, cellpadding: 0, cellspacing: 0, width: 325"]
[TR]

 			[TD="width: 87, align: right"]0[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD="align: right"]0.37[/TD]
 			[TD="align: right"]0.367[/TD]

[TD]Good[/TD]

[TR]
[TD="colspan: 3"]Without the camera plugged[/TD]
 			[TD="colspan: 2"]with the camera plugged in[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[/TABLE]

The top one is the first pin of connector.

I did also check the connector under the microscope and it looks clean.
I've replaced the 2 filters L4007 and L4009.

The board already had been fixed for liquid damage from U8330 down to U7100.

Any hint of this specific problem?
Where should look now please?

title: 820-3476 Camera not detected
message: I don't know by heart which voltage needs to go to the camera, but did you check if it's getting power?

title: 820-3476 Camera not detected
message: U3900 is a common problem. Trust me you rather not mess with that one, just live with no camera.

title: 820-3476 Camera not detected
message:
Camera is getting power yes.
I did already ordered some replacement U3900 chips from eBay with solder balls.
I will replace the chip and see what happens.

MacBook without a camera... OMG! (customer would think...)
Have to try to fix it.
